news.title: Seán Gallagher resigned from role at presidential hopeful Gareth Sheridan’s firm in row over $180,000 corporate box
news.summary: The former presidential candidate Seán Gallagher resigned as a director of Gareth Sheridan’s company in a row over a $180,000-a-year (€154,000) ­corporate box.

news.title: Man appears in court charged with murder of man and attempted murder of priest on same day
news.summary: A man has appeared in court charged with the murder of Stephen Brannigan and the attempted murder of a priest.

news.title: Benjamin Netanyahu reportedly in talks with South Sudan to take Gazans as Israel finalises invasion plan
news.summary: Israeli Prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu is reportedly in talks with South Sudan about ‘allowing’ Palestinians from Gaza to move there amid the ongoing Israeli offensive on the besieged Strip.

news.title: Irishman dies in Ecuador prison after being held over six-figure cocaine bust
news.summary: An Irishman has died in Ecuador, where he was being held in prison following a €600,000 cocaine smuggling bust.

news.title: Stephen Bradley tight-lipped on Jack Byrne row ahead of Shamrock Rovers’ Euro showdown
news.summary: Stephen Bradley has declined to elaborate on a row with Jack Byrne that is the reason for the Ireland international’s absence from the Rovers squad for their Conference League tie with Ballkani.

news.title: ‘I built a tiny house for €30k to escape the rat race – now I can live on €50 a week, easy’
news.summary: Having hit something of a roadblock in life, Paul Lawford decided to downsize his life in a most dramatic way. Tired of the Dublin rat race, he quit his job, sold his worldly possessions, and set about literally constructing an ambitious alternative to Ireland’s housing crisis.

news.title: How a log chalet home led to a 10-year planning row between three siblings
news.summary: A 73-year-old woman who was granted retention for her log chalet home is locked in a planning dispute after her two brothers objected to the decision.

news.title: Dónal Lynch: We’ve already had the TikTok Taoiseach, could we be ready for a LinkedIn leader?
news.summary: Is everything in ­Ireland ­corporate now? The ­upcoming Rose of Tralee, formerly mainly about gúnas, proud ­grannies and party pieces, has been described recently as a ­“networking event” for women. Its political counterpart, the presidential election, now threatens to go that way too.

news.title: Temperatures to reach 27C in areas but three counties hit with Status Yellow thunderstorm warning
news.summary: Another very warm day is on the cards right across the country, but some areas will be hit with thunderstorms later today.

news.title: Our IVF story: ‘Our little girl would not be here if our last embryo didn’t take’
news.summary: I always believed that being a mother was a natural part of a woman’s life. I thought that my body would just automatically know how to make a baby. So when my husband and I faced hurdle after hurdle once we started trying for kids, it made me question everything I thought I knew.
